# Introduction

This webpage is a wrapper for [PANDOC](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html). It is 
a powerful tool which can convert plain text into beautiful PDF files. The
following gives a brief overview over the things that are possible. This 
quickstart is still in an early version, so don't expect much ;).

# Syntax

## Markdown

Markdown is a lightweight markup language. In order to not get very confused, 
**only look at the PDF** for the next paragraph:

```Markdown
# Syntax

## Markdown

Markdown is a lightweight markup language.
```

The above is how the beginning of this document originally looks like before 
it's converted to PDF. You can verify this by looking at the editor on the
left side. Then you'll see the whole code of this document.

### References

- **Cheatsheet:** [https://guides.github.com/pdfs/markdown-cheatsheet-online.pdf](https://guides.github.com/pdfs/markdown-cheatsheet-online.pdf)

## LaTeX


The syntax of LaTeX (or TeX), a document preparation system, is more complex 
than Markdown, but also more advanced. There are many things you can do with 
it, that we'll just take a look at a few common and simple examples of how it's
used:

### Equations

A simple equation with code:

$$
E = mc^2
$$

```Latex
$$
E = mc^2
$$
```

A more complex (numbered) equation:

 egin{equation}
U(
u, T) =  rac{8\pi h 
u^3}{c^3}  rac{1}{e^{h 
u/kT} - 1} 
\end{equation}

can be written with this code:

```Latex
 egin{equation}
U(
u, T) =  rac{8\pi h 
u^3}{c^3}  rac{1}{e^{h 
u/kT} - 1} 
\end{equation}
```

## YAML Header

The thing at the top of the document contains header information like

```Yaml
---
title: Quickstart
author: Don Joe
---
```

A detailed list of options that can be added can be found at the 
[Pandoc MANUAL](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#variables-for-latex).

# Parameters

Parameters are additional settings that one would add in the terminal when
using pandoc in the terminal. The documentation for all params can be found
again at the [Pandoc MANUAL](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#general-writer-options).
However, not all params are allowed to be used on this site. To get an updated
list of params which are, navigate your browser [here](https://www.paperify.org/api/list/params).
You can play around with them in the text input above the editor.
